content.description: Start in the big fissure at the far left corner of the face on "The Spire", move up to any of the jugs on the top side of the boulder, The route's then a jug haul, keep your feet on the face until the top out at the top of the boulder.
content.location: The route starts in a big fissure/obvious hand hold on the far left of the face of "The Spire".

content.description: Climb up the south-west arete.  This is a high ball so be careful.  Great climbing that should not be missed!!!

Sit start on the most obvious, low, big, starting hold, move up to the slopey sidepull and then to a small sidepull out to the left that looks like it was recently chipped out. After that, continue up

Conspire

. The sit start adds a lot to this problem.
content.location: Sit start on the face problem of "The Spire".

content.description: Climb up the west face of the "Spire" on beautiful red/orange rock via solid crimps and long moves.  Great line!!!  A must for any devoted Three Sisters climber!!
content.location: The best way to get to "The Spire" is to park in the upper or second parking lot.  Take the "Bluebird Meadow Trail" EAST to its junction with "The Silver Fox Trail."  At this junction, continue east on the "Silver Fox Trail" until you run into the "Ponderosa Trail."  Once these two trials meet follow the "Ponderosa about 50 or so yards while looking uphill in a North/Easterly direction.  "The Spire" should soon come into view.  Then it's climb time.
